description.narrative: The proposed action aims to enhance earthquake and emergency preparedness and reinforce de-centralised response capacities in Dhaka. It takes the results of the Dhaka Earthquake and Emergency Preparedness (DEEP) project as a foundation and seeks to consolidate and enhance urban disaster preparedness. Â Specifically, DEEPER is designed to achieve four results of (1.) strengthened systems and volunteer capacities, (2.) enhanced preparedness for response of target wards, (3.) improved emergency preparedness of schools and health facilities, and (4.) increased risk awareness and preparedness amongst the wider population of Dhaka. Â Considering Dhaka's high earthquake risk and structural vulnerabilities on the one hand, and the city's centralised emergency response capacity on the other, DEEPERâ€™s overarching rationale remains the same as that of its predecessor: that central systems be complemented by decentralised (ward-based) volunteer capacities to ensure swift and effective response to everyday emergencies (such as fires) and major earthquakes. It does not seek to replace existing systems but aims to enhance them, and create better linkages between staff- and volunteer-based components. Â Yet, DEEPER goes deeper: first, it integrates a consolidated pool of volunteers into the city's emergency management system. Second, it aligns the software-based DEEPER interventions with mainly hardware-based support of major development partners. Third, it brings in digitalisation through 4 apps (to deploy + manage volunteers, and to raise awareness amongst Dhaka's population). DEEPER promotes a pragmatic approach to strengthen the agility to respond through a deeper focus on schools and health facilities, and expands coverage to 18 wards. Note: DEEPER project will be implemented by the consortium of German Red Cross (Lead), British Red Cross, Action Against Hunger and Christian Aid with BDRCS as an implementing partner.Â
